name: Heiko Paulheim
content: Prof. Dr. Heiko Paulheim | Universität Mannheim Skip to main navigation Skip to page content Skip to footer Credit: Bianca Lermer Chair for Data Science and University Vice PresidentB6, 26, Room B0.22heiko (at) informatik.uni-mannheim.deAssistant: Ms. Ezgi Yilmaz.Note: As of October 1st, 2024, I act as a university vice president, thus, my teaching is very limited. This also includes thesis supervision, for which I have strictly limited capacities. Open Science Grant for Andreea Iana and Martin BöcklingAndreea Iana and Martin Böckling receive a grant from the university's Open Science Office for the SpatialBenchRAG project.Two Papers Accepted at ISWC 2025The DWS group has two papers accepted at the International Semantic Web Conference (ISWC) 2025.Four Papers Accepted at ESWC 2025Four papers of the DWS group got accepted at the 22nd Extended Semantic Web Conference. This year, the acceptance rate was 22.4% for full papers in the research track.Michael Schlechtinger defended his PhD ThesisOn Thursday, September 26th, Michael Schlechtinger has defended his PhD thesis on “Investigating, Predicting, and Mitigating Collusive Behavior in Deep Reinforcement Learning-Based Pricing AIs”, supervised by Prof. Heiko Paulheim. The thesis has been conducted in the KarekoKI project, an ...all news Short CVsince 2024University vice president for digitalization, equal opportunity, and diversitysince 2018Full professor for Data Science, University of Mannheim2017–2018Substitute professor for Data Science, University of Mannheim2014–2017Assistant professor for Web Data Mining, University of Mannheim2013–2014Postdoctoral researcher, University of Mannheim2011–2013Postdoctoral researcher, Technical University Darmstadt2011PhD in Computer Science, Technical University Darmstadt2008–2011Research associate, SAP Research2008M.Sc. in Computer Science, Technical University Darmstadt2006–2008Researcher, University of Applied Science, Darmstadt2005B.Sc. in Computer Science, University of Applied Science, DarmstadtMore on the WebPublications on MADOC (University of Mannheim's Publication Server)Publications at DBLPPublications at Google ScholarSlides at SlideShareRecorded talks at VideoLecturesUpdates on TwitterResearch interestsKnowledge Graphs on the Web and their ApplicationsData Quality and Data Cleaning on Knowledge GraphsUsing Knowledge Graphs in Data MiningSocietal Impact of Artificial IntelligencePast and ongoing projects:CaLiGraph – a knowledge graph build from Wikipedia Categories and List PagesDBkWik – a knowledge graph build from thousands of WikisWebIsALOD –  a hypernym graph extracted from the WebRapidMiner LOD Extension – a tool for consuming semantic web data in RapidMinerRDF2vec – a method for transforming RDF graphs into numeric vectors for consumption in data miningAwards and NominationsBest paper award at Knowledge Graph and Semantic Web Conference, 2022. Nicolas Heist, Heiko Paulheim: The CaLiGraph Ontology as a Challenge for OWL Reasoners.Runner up for best poster award at Semantics 2021.
